Key Arguments: The submission expresses non-consent to the proposed legislation, arguing that it is a tool for censorship and oppression.
It claims that politicians and mainstream media are principal sources of misinformation and disinformation.
The submission argues that the legislation should apply equally to all media and public statements by politicians, otherwise it is deemed fascist.
It suggests that censorship is a sign of a weak government that fears free speech.
The submission includes a demand for financial compensation for any perceived harm caused by the legislation.
Main Themes: Criticism of political and media misinformation
Notable Quotes: The proposed Bill is an instrument for censorship and oppression, nothing less.
A government of strength does not fear the free speech of the people.
Censorship is a manifestation of the ideologies of Fascism and Totalitarianism.
